meanings.definition: A complex organic polymer found in the cell walls of plants.
meanings.sent1: The lignins in the plant cell walls help them stay strong.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study lignins to understand plant structures better.
meanings.sent3: The lignins in the cell walls were having a party, making the plants sturdy.
meanings.sent4: The lignins acted like the superheroes of the plant world, providing support and strength.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the lignins looked like tiny building blocks holding the plant together.

meanings.definition: A substance that provides structural support to plant cells.
meanings.sent1: Plant cells rely on lignins to keep them upright.
meanings.sent2: The lignins act as the pillars supporting the plant's structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous lignins played hide-and-seek in the plant cells, ensuring stability.
meanings.sent4: The lignins were the invisible architects of the plant kingdom, silently holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: In the garden, the lignins were the unsung heroes, holding up the plants with quiet strength.

meanings.definition: A component of wood that gives it strength and rigidity.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter admired the lignins in the wood for their role in making it sturdy.
meanings.sent2: Lignins are the secret behind the toughness of wood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous lignins in the wood whispered jokes to keep it strong and rigid.
meanings.sent4: The lignins were like the steel beams of the forest, providing support to the trees.
meanings.sent5: The lumberjack marveled at the lignins, realizing they were the backbone of the trees.
